name: Palm Beach Shores Resort and Vacation Villas

reviews.text: We were here for 2 nights in a suite (316) and although the unit is quite large, the unit just needed some TLC.
reviews.title: Use to be grand...now it's lost it's shine

likes.disliked: — Tired look of hotel and rooms

reviews.text: My husband and I had been here at this hotel about 9 years ago and the difference is very much night and day. Everything seems to look tired.
reviews.title: This Place was Disgusting!

reviews.text: Pros: good price (got the room for about $100 FL resident rate) for a suite with kitchenette that had a fridge, basic stove top, microwave, sink and some basic appliances (toaster, blender).
reviews.title: Loved Everything

likes.liked: — The newness and cleanliness of the room

reviews.title: Palm Beach Shores Resort
reviews.text: -close to the beach
-free valet parking (which we did not use) but you still get charged for parking at $6/day
reviews.title: Not A Resort This is a Motel

likes.disliked: — Dirty, bird dropping on balcony, noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a little hard to find because of some road construction and a detour. But the building is quite pink so we found it quickly. The hotel is perfectly right on the beach. The elevators were being replaced when we were there so we took the stairs a lot, but we didn't mind. We were only on floor 3. The old elevators work they're just slow. The pool area is nice but very full of kids. We ate at the restaurant on site on night. It was just okay. The drinks at the pool bar were good and strong. We cooked most of our meals in our room and the kitchen was well stocked and well functioning for what we needed. ONe night the handle fell off when I opened the convection microwave. We called the front and a man came up and replaced the whole microwave in minutes. We also did the timeshare presentation. They offered us free breakfast and a $75 visa gift card for doing the presentation when we arrived. We didn't schedule it then. On Tuesday morning (the day they wanted us to do the presentation on) when we woke up we thought maybe they would still let us do it. We called the front desk and they said if we could be down in the lobby by 9:30 that we could do the presentation and they would give us free breakfast and $100 visa gift card. So if you know how to say no in these presentations drag them on a little and they'll offer you more money to do it. Our salesperson was very polite until we said no. THen she flipped a switch and became quite rude and pushy. We expected this as we've done these presentations before. Just be prepared for them to be suddenly pushy when you start to say no and they will try to guilt you into it. BUt if you don't mind the 2-3 hour breakfast and presentation it is easy money and a free meal at the restaurant. THe building is old but the interior has been recently updated and it is well cared for and very clean. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. Oh, and wireless internet is free in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great Beach, Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I am an RCI member and owner of timeshare at the West Palm Beach Resort and Villas. I purchased my timeshare in August 2008. I decided to go for a leisure vacation after the holidays. After booking my reservation, I decided to go on line to read up about this resort since I had not used my time since purchase. I was surprised actually in shock to read a few negative reviews.. Since I was travelling solo, I had some concerns about going. I decided to go anyways and if it wasn't for me I would go home. I am so glad I went and did not let someone’s bad remarks discourage me.
reviews.title: The Best Time

reviews.text: From the moment I checked in there was friendly faces greeting me. Everyone was courteous and helpful, daily I was asked if I need anything - I was to let them know.
reviews.title: Family Fun

reviews.text: A few were aware I was travelling alone and made sure to keep a watchful eye on me, I appreciated their concern.
reviews.title: Ignore the Bad Reviews, this place was wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I truly felt like I was part of a big Happy Family where other RCI members return yearly. The Hotel sparkles and you can see they take pride in maintaining its charm and glamour.
reviews.title: Enjoyed a wonderful stay
Relax and Enjoy
reviews.text: This place is Great..... I'm really not sure what property many of the other reviewers below stayed at but it wasn’t Palm Beach Shores. Only thing I can figure is they are mega picky and are extremely paranoid—I mean extremely. We found the property clean, the staff friendly (especially Maria at the front desk) and very peaceful. There is a great one man band at the pool daily (different guy every day) that played a variety of music. The Pool is great (not very big) but just the right size for the resort. The pool bar staff is very friendly and they keep the drinks coming. I couldn’t believe how cheap the drinks were… $2.00 for a Beer, $4.00 for a mixed drink and $6.00 for a frozen drink—wow what a deal. They also delivered to the beach. We did get 2 chairs covered by a full Canopy on the beach. It was $30.00 for both of us for the day…not bad at all, Chairs at the Pool are free, and you can rent just a chair on the beaqch for much less or lay on a towel for free…. The room was Great—very roomy and had the best beds we’ve ever slept in. The Restaurant was good and prices were very reasonable. And it is absolutely safe to walk outside the property. My wife and I walked to the Marina several times at night—never a problem…. BTW, go to the Marina on Thursday Night—they have a craft fair with several venders and the food and drinks are great—quite the happening place. This is not a large resort, so don’t go with the expectation that there are 5 restaurants and tons of bars. If that’s what you are looking for, this place is not for you. If you are looking for a small quaint property, where you can relax and drive into town (5 minutes) for nice restaurants and nightlife…this is for you. We had a blast and highly recommend it….

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great experience at the resort. The hospitality of the staff at all levels was excellent. We lost both a camera and a pair of glasses in separate incidents - which were returned to us be the staff. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The pool and tiki bar were an added asset. We had dinner in the Islander restaurant which was exceptional. We would return in a heartbeat! Thank you to the staff for a great vacation experience.
reviews.title: Great Vacation Resort

likes.liked: — friendliness of the staff, pool area
likes.disliked: — not enough in the immediate area to do

reviews.title: The best Fl timeshare we ever stayed at.
reviews.text: This stay at Palm Shores was a time share exchange. We have exchanged many times in Florida and this was the best by far. Palm Shores is a true resort. It was previously a Ramada.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tthe rooms were clean,large and well equipped. The pool and beach were beautiful with adequate chaises arond the pool. The beach amenities were handled by a private concessionaire. The lobby sparkled. The restaurant was more than adequate for all meals.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: We would return in a heart beat if we were lucky enough to find it available.
reviews.title: Negative Impact

likes.liked: — The rooms are nice and the bed is comfortable
likes.disliked: — Pillows, parking,internet, sales people and their abusive/rude techniques

reviews.text: ...then this is a great resort. Nothing is close by. The rooms are very nice, with HUGE bathrooms. Two BIG bugs, now deceased, were the only icky arrival surprises. The kitchen is sparse: no oven other than a microwave w/ convection capabilities. Only two burners. (I like to cook A LITTLE). Our room was noisy. It backed up to the elevators and we heard the "swoosh/DING" all day/night long. One day we had NO water. Washer/dryer access was a nightmare. As an RCI exchanger, I'm spoiled by our home resort (Eagles Nest, Marco Island, Fl...awesome!) and expected better than the lowest floor w/ view of the parking lot (also noisy). Otherwise, the ocean was unswimmable due to wind, drop-off and sharks!. Beach was nice. Cabanas worth the money ( very windy during our stay. Cabana helped greatly). Staff extremely friendly. Pool is very clean, tho no chairs available after 9am. Spa was "foamy" by early evening...yuck. Restaurant, not bad and specials were above average. The facility was clean, expensive for extras, and you can walk NO WHERE for dinner/entertainment/shopping other than two rather "dive-y" bars. Somewhat sketchy area over the bridge. A terrible resort for older teen/early 20's children.Truly, nothing for them to do (OK, it does have a fitness center) unless you drive to Palm Beach. Great if you're retired/older or have young children and want to be in bed by 9 every night.
reviews.title: If you like to drive...

reviews.text: stayed 2/26-3/3/09 with 2 friends, very disappointed with staff service. . firsdt the room we had was on the ground floor with easy access from the public beach which we did not feel safe staying in . we switched to a corner unit which was much larger and very happy with . the problems came with the cleaning staff . on ethe second day there i went back to the room prior to my frinds from the beach and found the maid still working on the room . after she left I went in the shower and saw something shiney on the floor , it was glass , upon further inspection I realized it was a perfum bottle that was in the bottom of my make up bag (large bag} which I had kept back by the mirror on the vanity.. glass and the top of the perfume bottle were on the floor as well as the rug leading into the bedroom . she obvisouly had rummaged through my bag had thought she cleaned it up but did not finish when i arrived . i went down the hall and asked the clening person who had just been in my room if she had been in there which at first she denied until I remined her that I just saw her . I explained the situationand asked her to go in and finish cleaning , she refused ...she stated that she would go in only after she cleaned the room she had moved onto!!! upon my protest she did go clena but with a mop which she also used on the rug !!!!!! hench moving all the glass around. when i went to the front desk to complain they said they needed to have me speak with the housekeeping supervisor and that they had nothing to do with it . finally after explaing the situation to two different houseclening supervisors they had someone come in a clean the correct way , with a vaccum . the house keeping supervisor then handed me 30 dollars for my cost of the very small designer perfumethat i take with me for traveling .I have never stayed in any place that just hands you cash usually there is always a paper trail, apparently they wanted no record of their cleaning staffs mistake and snoopy behavior .
reviews.title: watch your belongings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we also had to go out and buy our own tissues since the first housekeeping person did not stock the room correctly . on the 3rd day we actually got tissues since the cleaning staff was actually efficent.
reviews.title: Positive experience

likes.disliked: — Lumpy pillows, but not that bad.

reviews.text: the second drawback to the place was the charge for parking , there is minimal parking if you do not want valet (more money for a tipplus the $6.00 a day fee} the staff we observed each morning parking very close to the front doors and not leaving spots for paying customers. this we found as a large fault on the resorts management .
reviews.title: beautiful beach friendly staff
Excellent RCI resort
reviews.text: the pool area is very small with many chairs crammed into one area .

aka: Palm Beach Shores Resort And Vacation Villas Hotel Palm Beach Shores
